instruction: Can the NNRW model be considered superior to traditional methods for geographical origin identification in traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) based on the research and validation conducted on spectroscopic profiling data?
Output: Yes,based on the research and validation conducted on spectroscopic profiling data, the NNRW (neural network with random weights) model can be considered superior to traditional methods for geographical origin identification in traditional Chinese medicine (TCM). The study compared the performance of four classification models, including NNRW, MLP, SVM, and DTC, on Raman and UV profiling data of radix astragali samples from four geographic regions. The validation accuracy of NNRW was found to be 96.3%, which was higher than the accuracies of the other models (98.0% for MLP, 98.4% for SVM, and 92.8% for DTC). Therefore, the NNRW model shows promise as a solution for resource-limited edge computing applications in TCM geographical origin identification.
